 Dosage: 3 to 6 g in decoction; or use in pill or powder form. 
 Do not use dan nan xing in cold type of cough or in condition of pixu (spleen deficient)

Take orally: 1.3–9 g for decoction.

Name: jie geng

Medical Function: has effect of loosening phlegm and discharging puss
Samples of Formulae:
Jie Geng Tang (桔梗湯): For fei yong (lung abscess). Symptoms: cough with chest fullness, chills with rapid pulse, throat dry without thirst, occasionally expectorates turbid foul-smelling sputum, over time spits pus like rice congee. Composition: Jie Geng (Platycodon root) 6 g, Gan Cao (Licorice) 12 g. Water decoction taken warm.
Jie Geng Bai San (桔梗白散).
Contraindications: Not to use in case of yinxu (yin deficient) with chronic cough, breathing difficulty and vomiting blood. 陰虛久咳，氣逆及咳血者忌服。
Chemical Ingredients: Root: small amount of polygalacic acid.
Root: platycogenic acid A; platycogenic acid B; platycogenic acid C.
From saponins the following are separated: prosapogenin; 3-O-β-glucose; platycodoside C; platycogenin-3-O-β-glucoside (platycodigenin); glucose; xylose.
From total saponins: platycodoside C; hydrolysis produces platycodigenin and glucose, xylose, rhamnose, arabinose (2:1:1:1).
Previously reported platycidin was proven to be a mixture.
Root: contains 14 amino acids; total content 1.22%.
